intro: Ebnerella goodridgei, commonly known as the Goodridge's sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to the wetlands and marshy areas of southern Africa, particularly in South Africa. The plant is characterized by its tall, narrow leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters. It typically grows in shallow water or damp soil, adapting well to its aquatic or semi-aquatic environment. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native range.
